alert.note: Alert for Gila (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 19 at 6:53PM MST until August 19 at 8:30PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Gila County along Tonto Creek in central Arizona... * Until 830 PM MST. * At 650 PM MST, Earlier this afternoon, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms that produced heavy rain in Gila County near Gisela. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.25 inches are possible due to lingering light rain. A stream gauge along Tonto Creek near Gun Creek continues to show elevated flows indicating on going flash flooding. The gauge has yet to crest, prompting an extension of this Flash Flood Warning. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Gisela and Tonto Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
